name: Hotel Diana Roof Garden

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights at the end of April 2008. The location is very convenient and we did receive the two adjoining rooms we requested as we were traveling with our 2 teenagers. However, the mattresses were rock hard and the shower didn't function properly; clogged shower head sprayed in different directions and water didn't drain well. We did complain but they were unable fix the problem. The other room had only a tub with a hand held shower hose. On the plus side, the roof garden is very nice and the breakfast was decent.
reviews.title: wouldn't recommend
Don't go out of your way
reviews.text: If you don't want a shoe box of a room where the door of the bath room bangs the toilet, and you look on to another building at arms length away from you, and where there are old and dirty marks on your bedroom floor, and if you don't want to listen to other people going to the toilet, or snoring, coughing or blowing there noses, and if you don't want scrambled eggs that seem to be from yesterday swimming in oil and leather hard, and rolls that are frozen in the centre, and cold machine coffee, then don't go out of your way looking for this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bellman was rude and service wasnt great. Location is good but not worth the service and cleaniness. I could here people in other rooms and hallway. dirty squeeky floors. Yuck!
reviews.title: dont stay! too many others that are better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through a travel agent, but was recommended through a travel magazine. The room was horrible, paint and wallpaper pealing everywhere and the room was stained with cigarette smoke. The room was small and faced a very noisy street and we had a view of the hotel across the street. Our shower turned into a bath if you were in it longer than a minute. Although we found the staff of the restaurant and housekeeping quite pleasant, the front office was a different matter. If we asked for information or directions, the responses were short and blunt as if they really couldn't be bothered with us. Not helpful at all. The only great thing about this hotel is that it is central to everything, but in saying this, there were at least 6 other hotels in the same street, so I would urge anyone considering booking here to look elsewhere. This was the worst hotel we stayed at while holidaying in Italy.
reviews.title: Aweful

reviews.text: When we booked this hotel through our travel agent I asked her to make sure that we would not have a room facing the street. Once we checked in I found out our room was facing the street.
reviews.title: The Street is loud

likes.liked: — The location near the train station
likes.disliked: — The traffic noise from the streets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Diana in November. Great location. Very nice, but small, room, but we weren't there much anyway. Inexpensive Internet cafe less than a block away - the Diana has i-net available in the lobby but it was down the week we were there. GREAT breakfast (included) every morning. Staff was great. Very clean hotel. we had a front-facing room with a patio, overlooking busy street below. But 6 floors up so noise wasn't a problem.
reviews.title: Great stay

likes.liked: — Central location, near to trains and buses, good concierge service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second stay at the Hotel Diana in Rome was better than our first. Our room was larger and the air conditioning ran for most of the day and kept the room comfortable.
reviews.title: Loved the Diana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff was very helpful and accessible. The Diana is located within walking distance of the Plaza Republica and several major churches. It's about a mile to the Coleseum and the Forums, but an easy and worthwhile walk.
reviews.title: Roof top garden excellent

reviews.text: I like clean rooms with working plumbing and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, like most European hotels there were not screens on the windows (Americans beware. Opening windows could invite mosquitoes, flies, etc.) Even though we booked through an on-line agency we got a recently remodeled room.
reviews.title: Great Location !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite some previous reviews we found all areas were smart and renovated - although we were a little alarmed to find the designated fire escape staircase firmly blocked up. However, there are solid fire doors on all corridors and 2 further solid doors to get into the room, so hopefully the fire brigade would have got to us in time in an emergency! We worked out where to place wet towels under the doors, just in case.
reviews.title: It can be chilly on the roof, but view worth seeing

likes.liked: — Convenience for access on arrival and for sightseeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean, and when I accidentally pulled the very long net curtain from the rail, it was replaced the same day without being asked. The black and green slippers provided were not in colours my wife fund attractive - but still an attraction as she has the same name as the hotel!
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay!

likes.liked: — How close it was to the train station/subway and within walking distance to many sites!

reviews.text: Staff command of Engish was not as strong as we would have expected in a hotel of this class, particularly as they were catering for guests from all over the world, many of whom were using English as their second tongue in the expectation they would be understood. One or two of the staff were offhand and surly, although this is often the case for service in Italy!
reviews.title: Nice place.

reviews.text: The roof top restaurant is a major plus. The menu is a little limited, but quite reasonably priced, and the view at sunset towards St Peter's can be stunning. Be warned, before going up to the roof, check the weather. It can get draughty up there. They do issue blankets on colder nights (from IKEA of Sweden), but nothing can stop the wind taking anythong not firmly weighted down! We were told ift had been unbearably hot the previous week.
reviews.title: Diana, more than we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is very convenient for tne main railway station with services to all parts of Italy, and beyond, as well as both airports (if using Ciampino you'll have to get a local train - aprox every 15 minutes, a 15 minute ride - and then the shuttle bus, but don't expect any help from hotel reception about that).
reviews.title: Sub standard service

likes.liked: — The cleaners were very polite and did a fabulous job.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel. The Staff were courteous and Friendly. The room was of medium size, but very clean. The towels were changed everyday. The shower was a large walk-in one. The Hotel is close to the Bus, Metro and Train station in a safe area with nice restaurants nearby. The breakfast was excellent and there was plenty of choice. Having booked out after breakfast , the Hotel kept our luggage for us until we returned in the evening, at no extra cost. We would use the hotel again. The only gripe is that there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room.
reviews.title: Comforatable Hotel

reviews.text: I took the express train from the airport to the Termini Station for 11 euro. Finding the hotel was easy with the map that I secured from the Italian Tourist Office in Chicago before I left the States. I requested the map through an email.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Diana for 6 nights over the recent Thanksgiving week. I would highly recommend this hotel. The location cannot be beat. I walked everywhere from the hotel, except to the Vatican. For that I took the handy metro at the Termini Station which is a five minute walk away from the hotel.
reviews.title: Well situated and comfortable but don't arrive early

reviews.text: Everything else like the Spanish Steps, Galleria Borghese, Pantheon, and Forum is about a 15-20 walk away.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: There is a grocery store about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. It's across the street from the S. Maria Maggiore church.
reviews.title: was not bad

description: Elegant Hotel offering modern comforts and amenities, restaurant and bar; situated in the heart of Rome near the Opera House.
